pageContext.description: Typology: double midrib; irregular e. bev. outside - whole surface rippled with longitudinal hammer marks
pageContext.surface: v. ruddy brown patina mainly intact.,Attached Material: apparently traces of wood on handle originally.
pageContext.other: Modern card, fields do not match data entry template
pageContext.composition: overwhelming Cu. Small amount Fe. No Zn As Pb or Ni detected.
pageContext.collection: HAYNES, Mr P - private,48 Aldred St, Clifton, Rotherham, S. Yorks.,S65 2AL
pageContext.site: YORKSHIRE,location not ascertained,Circumstances: apparently found using a metal detector, summer 1980, by Mr D Haynes in Common Woodland about 20 miles from his home (see RSO)
